org.jeo.util

Class Optional<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jeo.util.Optional<T>

  • public class Optional<T>
extends Object
    Utility object for dealing with references that may be null.

    This class is inspired by guava's Optional class.

    Author:
    Justin Deoliveira, OpenGeo

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <X> Optional<X> empty()
      Creates a new empty optional.
      Optional<T> filter(Predicate<T> filter)
      Applies a predicate to the optional, returning empty if the value doesn't match the predicate.
      T get()
      Returns the value or throws NoSuchElementException if the value does not exist.
      T get(String errMsg)
      Returns the value or throws NoSuchElementException if the value does not exist.
      void ifPresent(Consumer<T> c)
      Invokes the specified consumer if the optional is present.
      boolean isPresent()
      Returns true if the value is present, ie.
      <R> Optional<R> map(Function<T,R> f)
      Maps the optional to a different type.
      static <X> Optional<X> of(X value)
      Creates the new optional from the specified (possibly null) value.
      T orElse(T fallback)
      Returns the underlying value if the optional is present, otherwise returns the specified fallback.
      T orElseThrow(Supplier<RuntimeException> err)
      Returns the underlying value if the optional is present, otherwise throws the exception supplied by err.

      • isPresent

        public boolean isPresent()
        Returns true if the value is present, ie. not-null.

      • ifPresent

        public void ifPresent(Consumer<T> c)
        Invokes the specified consumer if the optional is present.

      • get

        public T get()
        Returns the value or throws NoSuchElementException if the value does not exist.

      • get

        public T get(String errMsg)
        Returns the value or throws NoSuchElementException if the value does not exist.
        Parameters:
        errMsg - The message to use for the exception if the value is null.

      • orElse

        public T orElse(T fallback)
        Returns the underlying value if the optional is present, otherwise returns the specified fallback.
        Parameters:
        fallback - Value to return if this optional is empty.

      • orElseThrow

        public T orElseThrow(Supplier<RuntimeException> err)
        Returns the underlying value if the optional is present, otherwise throws the exception supplied by err.

      • map

        public <R> Optional<R> map(Function<T,R> f)
        Maps the optional to a different type.
        Parameters:
        f - The mapping function.
        Returns:
        The new optional, or empty if this optoinal is empty.

      • filter

        public Optional<T> filter(Predicate<T> filter)
        Applies a predicate to the optional, returning empty if the value doesn't match the predicate.
        Parameters:
        filter - The predicate to apply to the value.
